column4: why does this page https://help.ubuntu.com/8.04/installation-guide/i386/hardware-supported.html say 486 is supported ? Confused :/
I didn't say it wasn't, I said it would be a pain trying to run Ubuntu on a 486 and I personally wouldn't, but it's up to you to take the plunge and try and run a GUI on a 233mhz
so it does it really take days to load ?
Not days per-se, but some time, yes.
I tried booting ubuntu off a livecd on a 533mhz PC, it took around 30 minutes to get to the desktop.
hmmm, I'm not sure I agree with your approach, if they were running win98 on it. gnome with all the extras turned off should be ok. But no matter.
30 mins is not days !
Well, you try using gnome on a 233mhz PC :P
yeah your recommended distros may be faster of course.
I might have to but an old 486 just to try this :P
Lol, you'll need to read the requirements on running a LiveCD of ubuntu on the ubuntu website. You need 256MB of ram I'd imagine.
seems important seeing that Ubuntu is aimed at low resource users ?
Not as low as a 486 for livecd, unfortunately. Maybe if you installed it instead of livecd and then went to fluxbox, then everything would work seamlessly.
Fluxbox is a lightweight window manager, sorry
who mentioned any livecd's ? I see your point though.
I'm assuming since you're a new user you'd automatically use the livecd. Sorry.
s'ok.
ok
I read something about Ubuntu for developing countries somewhere.
Ubuntu develops everywhere. The name derives from an african word.
well, anyway, we're down to semantics really. I can't find where I read about Ubuntu (the distro) in developing countries now. Interesting discussion. Laters.
Right. I'm here for Ubuntu Support, not about story telling philosophy's, sorry
